page.title: 12HOUSING
page.content: { Houses range from from listed and more traditional buildings to a relatively modern Council housing scheme at Holy- wood and new private bungalows in the Newbridge area. Many of the Council houses are for pensioners as are six in the converted Old School. 14 of the 73 Council houses are now owner occupied. There are still some tied houses but some farmers let their un- occupied on a short lease basis or occasionally as holiday lets. {Gribton Mansion}sub-divided into flats while{Dalawoodie House}has been con- verted into a private nursing home and can take 22 residents with a staff of 2 fulltime nurses and parttime trained and ancilliary staff. The home is government subsidised. The majority of properties are owner occupied and all but 8 derelict cottages are adequate.
